column4: Does anyone know the site where you can test what games you're able to play? For games like Doom3.
Who's installing the flash plugin? Why not get it from the adobe site?

Hello. I just had a problem when starting doom3-demo. I messed it up somehow, my screen resolution changed and I couldn't exit the game after it wasn't working. I ended up rebooting using a ctrl+alt+f1 terminal thing. How could I have exited the game without a restart?
gone to terminal 1 like you did and killed theprocess
killall doom3-demo
Exactly what I tryed.
wellt hat would have done it.  Or you can kill by pid  i.e. ps aux | grep doom3  get the pid and kill 12345123  or whatever it is.
That process sisn't exist, so I did a "ps -e | grep doom" and I found it and killed it, but when I did a alt+ctrl+f7, It wouldn't work.
then I would restart X sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart
yeah then you would just need to restart X
I found a process callled doom3.x86 or something, and killed it. Shouldn't alt+ctrl+f7 have went back to my desktop? I saw a cursor but it wouldn't even move.
I had the demo working ok before. I'm afraid to try and fix it now.
yes it would but if the resolution was all messed up you would have had to restart X to get it back.  hence the sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart
Ah, interesting. Would I lose my unsaved data?
yes most likely
Wouldn't ctrl+alt+backsace have the same effect?
yes unless X is completely frozen then you would have to do it the way I mentioned
A backup plan is always nice. Thank you.
there is also xkill where you can just click on an app to kill it.
if you hit alt+f2 to get a run prompt   then just type xkill
or make a keyboard shortcut for it.
